What is your favorite part about where you live??? It all comes down to location, location, location for me! 

Fun Fact: We first visited Telluride when Elizabeth was only three months old. Telluride was one of the few places my husband, Chris, had not been to at the time, so we packed our bags and left for a little getaway. (We were living in Texas at the time.) We got here during the monsoon season, so it rained all day. We didn’t really get to see how beautiful it actually was. Then all of the sudden around 6pm, the rain stops. The skies started clearing up. The sun came out... and there was this GIANT rainbow shining over Main Street in town. I looked at Chris and immediately said, “When can we move here???” 

I was joking at the time, but here we are! We ended up moving here five years later. AND fast forward to this time last year, we were getting ready to move into this total dream of a home! I feel SO much gratitude to be here with my family. 

What things do you love most about your home?? I’d love to hear about it! 

~Erin xo

Dry, thinning, or damaged hair?? There may be an easy solution! 

During peri-menopause and menopause, your hair is naturally prone to thinning. I really don’t want to have this struggle as it’s such an important part of my identity and I’ve watched I have watched my mom struggle for years! Thankfully, I have yet to experience any of this... and I give major credit to collagen for that. I have been adding collagen powder to my coffee for about 5 years now, and not only has it helped my hair, but I’ve seen improvements in my skin and nails too. 

I will link the collagen I use in my stories and on the @shop.ltk app along with some of my favorite clean hair products! There are also plant-based collagen options available for those of you who are vegan/vegetarian.

~Erin xo

Holiday dressing is as easy as 1 - 2 - 3 - 4! 

Who else is feeling the OVERWHELMING (yes, I’m yelling that!) pressure that comes with the holiday season? While most of the business comes from positive things - decorating, parties, holiday events, shopping, gift-wrapping, cooking, hosting... the list goes on - even the good things can start to feel stressful. 

One thing you shouldn’t have to stress over is what to wear for the holidays. Pick and choose between these 4 simple style tips to assemble a holiday-ready look with what’s already in your closet! 

1 | Add Some Sparkle - Effortlessly glam up any outfit with a little sparkle and shine. Think jewelry, sequins, and metallics! 
2 | Choose Holiday Colors - There’s nothing more festive than a beautiful red or green holiday piece. Just wearing a festive top can immediately take your whole look from “every day” to “holiday!”
3 | Swap Your Handbag - There’s no better time to bring the glamour than the holiday season. Try swapping your regular handbag for a luxe clutch or statement handbag. 
4 | Wear Festive Shoes - Amp up the holiday feels in seconds with the addition of a sparkly or festive pair of heels. Anything jeweled, sparkly, feathery, or satin would be gorgeous! 

And in this busy season of give, give, give... it is critical to pour into yourself as well. You are worthy of your own self care and self love. Whether that looks like setting aside time for yourself, buying yourself that special piece you’ve been eyeing, asking for help, establishing limitations, or simply saying “no” when something doesn’t serve you well, you are deserving and worthy of all these things. 

Alright... let’s do a quick check-in... How is everyone feeling right now?? Comment “CHECK-IN” if you’re in need of someone to talk to and I’ll send you a DM. The holidays can be a challenging time for many, but you are never alone 💗

~Erin xo

For more holiday style tips, be sure to check out my @youtube channel, Busbee Style! You can also shop each of these looks in my stories or on the @shop.LTK app.

It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas 🎄✨

And while the holiday season is filled with amazing things we all love like beautiful decorations, it can also bring ‘not-to-cheery’ stuff like sadness, overwhelm, even depression. 

How are you? Are you feeling overwhelmed? If so, you are definitely not alone. 

In years past, I would find myself struggling with overwhelm, feeling a sense of “should” and “have to” rather than the joy the season is meant to elicit. 

But this year…it’s different. I’ve decided to reclaim my love for the holidays and let go of the unnecessary pressure and perfectionism that used to derail my season. 

#1 | Your Relationship with Time 
For starters, I’ve reframed my relationship with time… instead of saying, “I don’t have time. Or there isn’t enough time.” I repeat, “Time is expansive and I have plenty of time!” 

#2 | Outsource if you Can!!
I also made the decision to outsource most of the decorating this year. I was staring at two car trips from storage, unboxing all of our stuff before even beginning decorating so I made the call to hire the most wonderful woman who is like a magical Christmas fairy. 🧚‍♀️ She created the most beautiful holiday tree I’ve ever seen! (i plan to outsource wrapping too!) if you can’t afford to outsource, keep the holiday decor very simple and only do things that light you up

#3 | Spend Time on the Things You Love
Are you excited to go all out decorating the house? Do it! Does the idea of decorating all day give you stress? Go minimal with a few simple festive touches. Do you love the idea of a schedule full of holiday activities? Fill yours up! Do you need more peace and calm this season? You are worthy of saying “no” to what doesn’t serve you best. 

The first step towards more peace this season is simply making the decision to pursue it. If you’d like to join me in committing to a more joy-filled holiday season, please comment #iamjoy below! You are deserving of so much joy in your life!

Wishing you all love and peace this holiday season ❤️

~Erin xo

(All holiday decor details are available on the @shop.LTK app) #liketoknowit #holidaydecor

Do you often feel anxious or overwhelmed?? Is a typical day filled with worry about how everything will be… how people see you… that something will go wrong… that you’re not doing enough… that there’s simply too much on your plate? 

Anxiety is a major problem for many women, and one that I struggled with for the majority of my life. In fact, my own personal anxiety was so rooted in my life that I wasn’t even aware it was a problem. 

it wasn’t until 2020… right after quarantine started… that I realized I had a problem. My anxiety became SO crippling I could barely function. 

For the last several years, I’ve been on a life-changing journey of healing. One of the simplest and most powerful tools I use to help with anxiety is… breathing. And it’s one that YOU can use anywhere, at any time. 

Two forms of breathing that I recommend trying are: 1) breathing in for 4 counts through your nose, then out for 4 through your mouth OR 2) taking quick deep exhales. Both of these help to calm the nervous system. So in your moments of overwhelm or when your mind is spiraling with doubts and stress, you can reset and calm the brain by trying these breathing exercises. 

For any of you who can relate to this, I want you to know... Your anxiety does not and should NEVER define you. You CAN get control of it. I’m happy to say that now, I am RARELY anxious. It’s like waking around with a new body. 

Do you suffer from anxiety?? What have you tried to help ease your suffering?

Be sure to bookmark this post and come back to it when you need it. 

Sending you all so much love💕 

~Erin xo  

#anxiety #anxietytips #wellnessover40 #anxietyhelp 
#womenover40 #anxietyrelief

New year... new lofty resolutions you’ll struggle to keep??? 

It’s that time of the year when we often create lists of resolutions for the upcoming year. Many of these are wellness related... cutting out sugar, exercising more, following a special diet... and while these are positive goals, they are often difficult to maintain. And if you’re like me, when you break your resolutions, you trigger an unhealthy spiral of guilt and shame.

This year I’m taking a softer, more mindful approach to wellness by listening to my body. Being “healthy” doesn’t mean being at your slimmest. Being physically, emotionally, and spiritually healthy are all equally important. Every day, I’m choosing to make small choices to take care of my mind and body. This might look like starting my day with a nourishing green smoothie, meditating and journaling, or walking the dog. It means slowing down, resting, and even playing more too. 

One simple way I find motivation for mindful movement is with a new, cute activewear set. This metallic celestial print activewear set from @Nordstrom is SO comfortable. The fabric is super soft and high quality. You could wear this set to a high-intensity class, to yoga, or just to relax at home. And the coordinating faux shearling pullover is a cozy touch. It’s perfect to wear before and after a workout or to run errands and pick up the kids from school.

If you feel good, you look good...

We often hear this phrase said the other way around, but the truth of the matter is that when you feel calm, peaceful, confident, and free inside... everything else reflects that on the outside. Great style comes from within and if we don’t love ourselves, that will show on the outside. 

Over the past six months, I’ve started shifting my beliefs and my relationship with my body. I am still in the early stages of my own journey, but I believe this topic is crucial to discuss. As women, we are conditioned by society to believe much of our value comes from looking a certain way... to be a certain size and shape, wrinkle-free, and cellulite-free. We’re bombarded with images on tv, magazines, social media that reinforce this message that in order to be “beautiful” or “worthy,” we have to look a certain way. Not only are these ideals physically unattainable for most women, this couldn’t be farther from the truth. 

Achieving a better relationship with your body takes time. It is very difficult for most of us, myself included. But it IS possible, and it is LIFE-CHANGING. And it all begins with a desire to change. 

To hear more about my personal story… and my tips on how to reframe your inner dialogue and improve your relationship with your body, visit my YouTube channel, Busbee Style. (The link is in my bio.)

You deserve to be filled with love, light, and joy, and you deserve to shine… ✨ Exactly as you are right now. 

~Erin xo

Do you make New Year’s resolutions each year? This year, in lieu of resolutions, Team Busbee is embracing one-word intentions.

A one-word intention is a desire and a theme for your year. It’s a word you can come back to over and over again to make sure you are on the right path. 

For 2023, my words are “Alignment” and “expansion”. (yes, I picked two!) 🥰 I have gone through and experienced SO MUCH transformation and healing in 2022, so this year I want to expand on that and make sure everything is “aligned” and creating “expansion” in my life. I believe when you are aligned, you are living in your true essence, your most authentic self, which inherently leads to expansion.

So what does living an aligned life look like? Part of it is… going with the flow more and balancing that “do, do, do” hustle mentality with the feminine energy of rest and play. Alignment also means only saying yes to projects (and people) that really light me up… things I am passionate about… experiences that bring joy. This doesn’t mean I never unload a dishwasher or do laundry, some chores are necessary, but I can bring fun to the mundane through music or listening to a podcast. Alignment and expansion are also exciting to me!! It’s important that your word(s) also light you up.

Flattering… x5!!!

There are certain style details and fits that are super flattering on just about every body type. These components are KEY to look for when shopping for chic basics that will make you feel and look amazing. 

This beautiful cable-knit sweater dress caught my eye for several reasons. Not only is it super cozy, it has several very slimming features…

#1 |  V Neckline - V necklines are universally flattering. They help to elongate the neckline (giving the appearance of more height) and draw attention to the center of the body to enhance the waistline.
 #2 | Defined Waist - Any details that help to define a waist… color-blocking, belts, tailoring, or in this case, a pattern shift and zipper… help to give the illusion of a smaller waist and hourglass figure. 
#3 | V Waistline - When done correctly, this detail is ultra-slimming… but be wary of V waistlines that sit too low as these actually can accentuate a tummy. The V should be located right at your natural waist (the narrowed part of your body between your hips and chest). 
#4 | Body-Skimming Fit - Many women shy away from tighter tops and dresses in hopes of hiding insecurities, but looser dresses and fits can actually add visual mass. A body-skimming fit is not tight against the body, but rather drapes gently over it. 
#5 | Light- to Mid-Weight Fabric - Slimming sweaters can be trickier to find, because let’s face it… sweaters are inherently more bulky. I recommend looking for light to mid-weight sweaters with quality materials (like cashmere) to stay warm without the bulk.

Do you sometimes feel “less than” when scrolling through social media? You are NOT alone!! So many of us, myself included, occasionally see people on IG and think that person is more fit, beautiful, smarter, wealthier, etc.... It’s easy to get sucked into playing the comparison game, which leaves most of us feeling defeated… like we aren’t good enough. 

Theodore Roosevelt said, “Comparison is the thief of joy,” and this couldn’t be more accurate. The reality is in the comparison game, we ALWAYS lose. That’s why it’s very important to recognize 2 things: 1) social media is mostly a curated highlight reel that doesn’t accurately represent reality, and 2) you can always unfollow someone or take a break from social media (she types as she is about to post on social media). 

However, there is a third option - 3) Find the wisdom in the trigger! 

Consider WHY the person or post is bothering you.  I found myself really triggered a year ago by a super fit woman on Instagram. I was mentally comparing my body to hers. (She was much more toned and fit.) After a bit of distance, I realized “why” this person was triggering me. I wanted my body to look more like hers. Secretly, I hated my new menopausal body. This trigger ended up being one of the reasons I started  my journey towards self-love and acceptance. It was the catalyst for me understanding how brutally I used to pick myself apart and how no matter what I did or how I looked, it was never enough. 

Even if we are not where we want to be, remember there is only ONE of you. You are a beautiful, vibrant, and powerful woman. You have your own special gifts and abilities that are meant to be shared with the world. 💗 

How do you handle it when you find yourself triggered by social media? Please share in the comments. Remember that your words have power. What you share may be the one thing someone else needs to read. 

~Erin xo

#selflove #selfcare #selflovejourney #womenover40 #youareworthy

🚨This is a GAME-CHANGING winter style tip!🚨

This amazing fashion hack has been blowing up on social media... and with good cause! It will change the way you wear turtlenecks forever. 

What’s the trick? Instead of folding your turtleneck out and over... fold it inward. The end result is a chicer, sleeker, and a more flattering look. It also allows you to change how deep the fold is. Do you prefer a higher neck? Do a shallow fold. Do you prefer a bit more space around your jawline? Make a deeper fold. Grab a piece of paper, a pen, and your tape measure... It's time to determine your body shape!

There are several methods for determining your body shape... some involving complex ratios and percentages... but these can get pretty confusing! To simplify things, I've broken everything down into an easy system using four key body measurements: shoulders, bust, waist, and hips.

First things first... Why is it so important to know your body shape? Understanding your body shape will help you create balance in proportions and dress in a way that flatters YOU most. There are five body shapes - Triangle, Inverted Triangle, Circle, Rectangle, and Hourglass. (Though it is possible to be a cross between two of these shapes.) Whatever your body shape, remember... every body is unique and beautiful, and knowing your shape is simply a guide to help you look and feel the most confident in what you wear. 

Once you know your body shape, don't toss those measurements! These are super useful to have on hand when ordering clothes. Manufacturers use different sizing charts, so checking your measurements against the sizing charts can end up saving you time and money.

What is your body shape? Please share in the comments!

~Erin xo

Have you ever thought to yourself, “I don’t deserve that...” 

There are so many of us who feel unworthy... unworthy of experiences, gifts, time, love, and attention. Like many, I bought into the narrative FOR YEARS that in order to be worthy, I needed to be “nice” and “good”…pouring into everyone else, putting my own needs and desires aside. 

No matter your age, your circumstances, your appearance, your abilities... YOU ARE WORTHY. 

I’m going to repeat that... YOU. ARE. WORTHY. 

Let this be the time where we start stepping into our power... where we become confident in our own skin, acknowledge the value we bring to the table, and go in full pursuit of our dreams! It’s taken me a really long time to feel worthy, and I want you to feel that and embody that too. 💕

There may be things you don’t have that you want to have that throw you off your worthiness game. Maybe your bank account isn’t where you want it to be. Or maybe it’s your body or a relationship that isn’t where you want them to be. None of this is indication that you deserve anything less than your absolute wildest dreams. 💫 

Where would you rate your self worth on a scale from 1-10 (1 being the LOWEST and 10 being HIGHEST). If you’re on the lower end of the spectrum, I challenge you to look at yourself in the mirror today and tell yourself two things: “I am worthy.” and “I love you.” These simple three-word sentences hold so much power, and by saying them out loud as we look ourselves in the eye, we can begin to believe them. 

Maybe your self worth is on the upper end of the spectrum... What are some ways you can pour time, love, and attention into yourself this week? Please share in the comments! Your comment may be just the inspiration another woman needs. 

I’ll start... This week I am taking time away from my family for personal growth and building new connections! 

~Erin xo 
 
#selfworth #youareworthy #selflove #selflovejourney #womenover40

For years, my happiness hinged on the approval of others... my husband, family members, friends, colleagues, etc. I always felt like I had something to prove. But, what I’ve discovered in my 40’s is that it’s FAR MORE important and powerful to seek out your own approval and look within for your worth.

What is the first step towards finding your worth within? #1) Get to know yourself better. Really understand what lights you up. Your likes and dislikes. Be your own best friend and cheerleader. 

I like to refer to your most authentic, beautiful, powerful self as your “inner goddess” (aka queen, true self, divine feminine). Connecting with your inner goddess is a way to help you connect more deeply to your feminine energy.

5 simple steps to elevate your style! ⬇️

Whether you’re looking to take your look to the next level or you simply want to feel a little more put together on a day when you’re feeling “less than,” these small style tweaks and additions will help you look chic, polished, and put-together! 

1 | Fold Your Turtlenecks Inward - The inward fold looks more streamlined and polished! 
2 | Add Jewelry - Go bold with trendy statement jewelry or opt for timeless pieces like these gorgeous hoop earrings. 
3 | Choose Elevated Footwear - While there’s a time and a place for utilitarian shoe choices, opting for more flattering, modern footwear can transform an entire look! The right footwear can also create the illusion of longer legs. Try matching your shoes to your pants to achieve the look of legs that are a mile long.

A MUST-READ for all women...

Last fall, a member of Team Busbee was the target in a horrific attempted abduction. I know... I can hardly believe I am writing that...

We all know human trafficking exists, and that abductions occur every day, but it’s easy to dismiss the danger thinking that it won’t happen to you or in your town. 

The reality is… over 1 million people are trafficked each year for the purpose of sexual exploitation or forced labor. Human trafficking is a global problem, and it’s happening everywhere... including affluent neighborhoods and our own backyards. 

Today on BusbeeStyle.com, Alissa, our social media manager, is sharing her story. Our hope is that by sharing her story, we can help spread awareness and help keep you safe. It is vital that we as women educate ourselves about the risks, how to be vigilant, and measures we can take to protect ourselves and loved ones. 

Please be sure to read Alissa's story and to even share it if you feel called to. I will share a link to the post in my stories, but you can also visit the blog through the link in my bio.

The one... the only... La Suite Dior 💫

I had the unique honor of staying in La Suite Dior the night before the #DiorAW23 show. La Suite Dior is the only hotel suite in the magnificent flagship @Dior store on Avenue Montaigne in Paris. It’s such a historical location, as it’s the original location that Christian Dior strategically chose for the fashion house. It’s also where many of the original fashion shows took place. And wow... it is stunning! The décor in the suite on the upper level is so beautiful and elegant, from the golden wall paneling in the dining room to the full Onyx bathroom to the renowned artwork on the walls. 

In reflecting on my experience there... which also included private overnight shopping in the boutique, fine-dining in Le Salon Historique de Monsieur Dior, and a personal tour of La Galerie Dior in my pajamas (unreal!)... I’m truly overwhelmed with gratitude. This was a MAJOR dream come true for me. And it came true at 48 years old. If you told younger me I would be doing this, there’s no way I would have believed you. 

It can be so easy to dismiss your dreams as too grandiose or to tell yourself you’re not enough to pursue them. Don’t be afraid to chase after your dreams. Believe in the magic this world has to offer you...because let me tell you, there is so much of it!!! 🌟✨ What small step can you take today towards one of your dreams? 

You are worthy of EVERY dream you have (and those you can’t even imagine.) Believe in the MAGIC!!! 

Thank you to the entire Dior team that made this amazing experience possible. 

~Erin xo

My full @Dior fashion show experience is LIVE on the blog!!! 🌟✨

For the last decade, I’ve dreamed of attending Paris Fashion Week. I kept putting the dream aside because it felt totally unattainable to me. I thought to myself, “I’m not a major 'influencer.' I don’t have millions of followers. I’m also 48 years old.” Most of the influencers that attend shows are MUCH younger, slimmer, prettier, etc. (Yes, some serious imposter syndrome was creeping in.) 

Six months ago, I decided now is the time. I booked the flight and the hotel to Paris, but had no idea how I would get into a show. The design houses/brands approve each attendee and gives them a non-transferable, handwritten invitations. In other words, it’s hard to get in. I decided to simply surrender and see what unfolded. I hired a travel designer based on a friend’s recommendation, even though I had no clue what a travel designer is. She said she would try to help, but made no guarantees. Again, the brand has to approve you. We submitted bios and a link to our IG accounts and hoped for the best. 

TWO days before I was scheduled to fly to Paris, an offer came in to attend a fashion show… and not just any fashion show…the @dior fashion show! ✨💫✨

To hear ALL of the details of this incredible experience, head to the blog, BusbeeStyle.com. You can find the link in my stories or in my bio! 

The first step towards my dream..? Taking a leap of faith and booking the flight. In the comments, please share one of your dreams and maybe one step you can take towards making it a reality. Sometimes the scariest part is just saying it out loud - or sharing it publicly. 

Remember…your words may be the inspiration another woman needs to dream bigger. 💞

~Erin xo

When it comes to spring and summer style, a must-have closet essential is... a white dress!

These are my TOP style tips for choosing denim shorts... at any age!!!

#1 | Check The Rise – High-waisted shorts can be very flattering (when they don’t highlight the lower tummy – fit is key). 9” to 12” inches is considered high rise. I prefer high-waist shorts because they make my legs look longer.
#2 | Fingertip Test – Are the shorts too short?? Put your arms down by your sides. If your shorts are much shorter than the end of your fingertips, you might want to opt for a longer inseam. If they are close or even below the fingertips, you are good! Longer arms? Be sure to add that into your calculation here. And, remember this is just a guideline. 
#3 | Consider the Fit - If the leg holes are a bit wider, it will make your thighs look smaller! Sometimes jean shorts have a sort of triangle shape where the legs bell out slightly (Like the pair I’m wearing). That’s the most flattering and slimming style.
#5 | Size UP - With denim shorts, it’s best to size up one size. You don’t want anything too tight in the waist creating a muffin top.

And if you’re on the lookout for a super flattering pair of denim shorts, these are SO good! They have an 11” rise and 4” inseam so you feel secure in the tummy area and covered in the bum area. The vintage fading is minimal and there’s also no distressing… something I know many of you prefer!

What to pack for your next trip to Europe??

I’ve shared many blog posts and @youtube videos over the years on what to wear when you travel, but when it comes to style travel essentials... These 3 items are my top MUST-HAVES! 

#1 | Comfortable Walking Shoes - Whether you plan to shop, sight-see, or simply walk around, you NEED comfortable walking shoes. For a typical trip, I tend to pack two comfortable pairs of shoes and one standout pair (typically heels). NOTE: White sneakers are a really popular choice in Paris and European cities right now. I chose to pack my black sneakers because I felt the darker tone would be more chic and elongating for my legs. 
#2 | Chic Sunglasses - Not every day may be sunny on your trip, but a stylish pair of sunglasses is both practical to have and an easy way to elevate an outfit. I recommend choosing a pair that is black or dark brown, so they can easily coordinate with most of your travel wardrobe. 
#3 | Crossbody Handbag - This is a must for several reasons... The crossbody strap enables you to be hands-free for shopping and sightseeing, but it’s also the most secure option to prevent theft. I prefer my crossbody bags to be a bit larger, so I can easily fit my passport, wallet, keys, phone, lipstick, and any other essentials inside. I also LOVE a crossbody bag with a pocket in the back. It’s the perfect place to tuck your phone for easy personal access! 

Do you have any other style must-haves for travel? Please share in the comments... I would love to hear!

When it comes to swimwear, I believe having a chic and stylish coverup for your next pool/beach day is almost just as important as the swimsuit itself. Here’s what I look for when shopping cover-ups... 

1 | Easy to put on and take off - I prefer cover-ups that don’t have to go over my head.
2 | Lightweight & breathable - Fabrics like cotton and linen are perfect for cover-ups because you will stay cooler, and they dry faster.
3 | Good coverage - A good cover-up should provide some actual coverage and protection from the sun.
4 | Neutral color - A bold cover-up can be super gorgeous, but if you’re shopping for a cover-up to wear for years to come, it’s often best to select a neutral color (whites and creams will keep you coolest) to effortlessly match all your swimwear. 
5 | Dual-purpose - While this one isn’t essential, it is an amazing bonus if a cover-up can serve more than one purpose in your wardrobe. ( i.e. This amazing eyelet button-down that can also be worn as a shirt dress or oversized top.)

5 tips to wear the sheer trend without feeling too risqué...

Transparency, sheerness, and anything that has that see-through or a peek-a-boo element… is very “in” right now! I personally love this trend. It’s a great way to show a little skin but still feel covered up, elegant, and sophisticated. If you’re hesitant or unsure how to wear the trend... these are the style tips for you!

#1 | Layer over a Sheer Blouse - This is the simplest way to wear the sheer trend!
#2 | Try Different Sheer Fabrics - Experiment with different sheer fabrics like lace, tulle, organza, and crochet.
#3 | Layer under a Sheer Blouse -  Try a sheer top with a sexy bralette or camisole underneath.
#4 | Take It to the Max! - Go head-to-toe sheer, but wear strategic undergarments like a bodysuit and tights to add additional coverage. 
#5 | Shop Strategically Sheer Pieces - Look for sheer pieces that have strategically placed panels of sheerness and non-sheer fabrics.

We finally did it!!!!

After 3 years of rescheduling, we made it on our highly-anticipated Busbee family African safari trip! And it was every bit worth the wait!!! Here is a quick rundown of our trip for anyone who’s interested…

We flew into Johannesburg and stayed at our airport hotel.
Then we flew to Kasane and Chobe National Park in Botswana and stayed at @sanctuaryretreats in Chobe. They had 2-bedroom lodges perfect for our family and it was the closest to the park. We loved our guide, Chika!
Then we flew from Kasane to Nxabera in Okavango Delta and landed on a dirt landing strip and our safari guides arrived early to ensure no animals were on the runway.
We stayed at @andbeyondtravel which ended up being our favorite place that we stayed. They sang on our arrival and departure which was so sweet. The tents were connected by a passageway which made me feel comfortable. You don’t want your kids to be alone without easy access to you in these camps. And we loved our guides Richard and KB!
Then we flew to Kasane and drove to Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe. We did a canopy tour, zip lining, a tour of the falls, and an elephant excursion where you could touch and feed wild elephants. We stayed at @the_elephant_camp which was very close to the falls and the activities.
Then we flew to Cape Town. There we swam with sharks, went whale watching, had some fun dinners, and did a Table Mountain visit. We flew home from Cape Town.

For details on what I packed for our 2-week trip, head to the blog, BusbeeStyle.com. I also shared a reel yesterday featuring many of my outfits! 

Have you been to any of these places? Or maybe one is on your bucket list?? Please share in the comments.

Have you ever heard of dopamine dressing??

 It’s a trend that sprung up in 2022 and it's still going strong! Basically you dress in a way that’s meant to boost your mood... and one way to do that is to wear bright colors! I personally love to add bright pops of color to my wardrobe, BUT, I know that wearing bright colors is out of some of your comfort zones. So today on the blog (link in bio), I'm sharing some fun outfit ideas that will have you feeling more confident wearing color.

A few quick tips to get you started...
#1 | Choose colors wisely - Think about what colors you like, try wearing them, and if the color lights up your face, it’s the color for you! Jewel tones like cobalt blue, emerald green, or deep red are great colors to try out if you’re new to the color game.
#2 | Try Bold Accessories - A bold accessory is one of the easiest ways to add a pop of color! A bright pair of shoes, a bold-colored bag, some fun colorful sunnies, or even a brightly colored printed scarf are all great options for adding some color to your wardrobe.
#3 | Pair Colored Clothes w/ Neutrals - Try mixing your one piece of colorful clothing with neutrals. All-white outfit? Add a blue blazer! All black outfit? Add a red handbag. All brown outfit? Add a pop of pink!

Do you want to look and feel taller?? 

I have found so many useful tricks over the years to help elongate my frame and look taller and slimmer. These tips are geared toward petite women, which means 5’4” and under… but they’re applicable for anyone, really!

#1 | Match Shoes to Pants - It’s a seemingly small detail but it really does elongate your legs!
#2 | Wear a Low-Cut Shoe - Wearing low-cut shoes with skirts or dresses as opposed to high-cut or ankle-strap heels will make your legs look much longer.
#3 | Match Your Shoes to Your Skin Tone - Similar to what I mentioned in the last tip.. when you wear skirts and dresses, you should wear shoes that more closely match your skin color for a longer leg line. 
#4 | Wear High-Rise Pants - When you wear high-rise pants and jeans, you create the illusion of more length and longer legs.
#5 | Choose Your Leg Silhouettes Strategically - Make sure your pant or jean silhouettes are straight, bootcut, wide, or flared. Those leg shapes will fall further to the ground. It sounds like a no brainer, but if you have this longer silhouette, it creates the look of a longer leg. 
#6 | Try Monochrome Dressing - Wearing similar colors from head-to-toe creates the illusion of a longer and leaner silhouette. 
#7 | Wear a Shorter Hemline - For petite women, wearing shorter hemlines is often much more flattering than wearing longer midi-length hemlines. 

Which of these tips will your try next??

~Erin xo

Do you want to look and feel taller... instantly?? 

Through my years as a personal stylist and with my own personal experience, I have found so many useful tricks over the years to help elongate my frame and look taller and slimmer. These simple style tips are geared toward petite women, which means 5’4” and under… but they’re applicable for anyone, really!

#1 | Wear Pointed-Toe Shoes - This may seem like a small tip, but if you want to maximize the length of your legs, a pointed-toe shoe will really help. More specifically… a closed-toe, point-toe, matching-tone shoe.
#2 | Try a Jumpsuit - This is one of my favorite tips for petite women. Jumpsuits can be tricky if you have a long torso or are really tall, but they’re SO flattering and can make you look really tall. 
#3 | Wear Cropped Jackets - Cropped jackets help to create the illusion of longer legs! 
#4 | Tuck in Your Top - Tucking in your top will make your legs look longer. Add a waistbelt, and BAM… legs for days!
#5 | Choose Scoop Neck or V Neck Tees - The V or scoop are more elongating for the torso and minimizing for the bust (if you have a big bust). It’s not a hugely impactful detail, but when you add this to some of the other tips I’ve shared, they really add up to create the perfect, lengthening look!
#6 | Carry Small to Midsize Handbags - For those of you who are shorter, you probably want to carry a more mid-sized handbag versus a huge, oversized tote for better proportions. 
#7 | Wear Heels - This is a fail-safe way to add some inches. If you don’t love wearing heels, try to find a pair that are super comfortable and make you feel supported like wedges, block heels, or smaller platforms.
#8 | Wear Tailored Clothing - If you’re petite and you wear something super oversized, it can swallow you up and make you look shapeless. A more tailored fit creates more shape, is more flattering, and makes you look taller and leaner.

Which of these tips is your fave??

~Erin xo

Who wants to know the secret to a voluminous ponytail?? 🤫👇🙋🏼‍♀️

Some of you may remember this reel from last year, but I thought it was time to re-share as the temps begin to rise and you begin wearing your hair up more often to stay cool! 

Whether you were born with fine, thin hair or have hair that’s thinning with age (menopause can def wreak havoc on your hair)... these simple hair tricks will help you achieve the look of a more youthful, voluminous ponytail! 

Step #1: Pull your hair back into a high ponytail. (I prefer to leave out a few flattering face-framing strands in the front.) 

Step #2: Separate your ponytail into an upper and lower section. Secure the upper section with a second hair tie. 

Step #3: Tease the underside of your ponytail. 

Step #4: Brush the top side of your ponytail to smooth out any fly-aways and frizz. 

That’s it!! Now, you have a more full looking and chic ponytail!!!! 

If you try it, please let us know what you think in the comments…

~Erin xo

The shirt tuck you NEED to try this summer!! 

There are many simple style tricks you can do to elevate an outfit. One I swear by is... tucking your top! Tucking your top adds INSTANT waist-definition, often times giving your figure a more flattering silhouette. My go-to is a half tuck, but you could also do a full tuck, tie tuck, crossover tuck, etc. (Sharing more of these soon!) I recently learned about this new tuck, and I’ve been trying it with all my summer button-downs...

1 | Start by unbuttoning the last two buttons on your top
2 | Take one shirt tail and thread it through the bottom gap between buttons, going from the outside-in
3 | Take the opposite shirt tail and do the same, also threading from the outside-in
4 | Pull the shirt tails taught to tighten the faux knot
5 | Tuck the shirt tails into your bottoms

You’ll be left with a pretty knot at the base of your top that doesn’t add any bulk! 

Have you tried this trick? Let me know what you think! 

~Erin xo

Does “affordable” fashion come at a cost???

Have you ever seen a cute item that’s really cheap... Then you buy it, take it home, and find the fit isn’t right and the fabric is uncomfortable, itchy or quickly unraveling...?? I know I’ve been guilty all too many times. Whether it’s in-store or online - the temptation is real! 

But not only do these pieces often wind up being bad for your wallet, buying into “fast fashion” can come at a deeper cost to both you and the environment. The origin and production of pieces, the impact manufacturing has on our planet, and even the toxic chemicals used on some (yep, gross!) are just a few MAJOR issues surrounding these pieces..

I shared my thoughts with Team Busbee back in 2020. After a lengthy discussion and collective agreement, we made a conscious shift toward wearing and recommending brands that are not “fast fashion” …meaning they don’t fall apart after a few washes and are made of high-quality, non-toxic fabrics. And the exciting part is that it’s not just Team Busbee that’s committed to the change... sustainable fashion is now majorly trending! 

Making a shift towards sustainable fashion can seem overwhelming at first, but when you make small changes over time, it will feel much more manageable. And, you know what? It doesn’t have to be perfect. It’s just like clean eating or clean beauty… it doesn’t have to be 100%, you just do your best. Simply reading the fine print, understanding fabrics, and the brand behind the garments can help you make smarter, safer choices.

Do you have an incredible, sustainable brand you love? Please let me know in the comments. Team Busbee is committed to this effort… a different kind of fashion transformation. 

~Erin xo

Define your waist instantly with a simple nip and tuck of… of your shirt!!

Many of you know I am a big fan of the half tuck... which is exactly what it sounds like— tucking in half of your shirt. While this style trick garners quite A LOT of controversial feedback, I stand behind it as a super chic, effortless, and not-so-fussy way to add definition to your waist. 

And there’s more than one way to try this game-changing style trick! These four simple shirt tucks are majorly flattering and so easy...

1 | The Classic Half Tuck — Simply tuck the front of your top into your pants, loosen the tuck a bit, and you’re set to go! 
2 | The Hair Tie Tuck — Using a clear hair tie, secure the front ends of a button-up top near your last button. Flip the tie up and under your top... et voilà! 
3 | The Hair Tie Tuck II — Like the second tuck, secure the front ends of a button-up top near your last button with a clear hair tie. This time, instead of flipping the ends up beneath your shirt, tuck the tie into your pants.
4 | The Criss-Cross Tuck — Begin with an unbuttoned shirt (you’ll likely want to wear a cami underneath). Take the left side of your shirt and tuck it in on the right side, then take the right side of your shirt and tuck it on the left side. This creates a really flattering V-neck fit and looks SO chic! 

Have you tried any of these tucks? Which is your fave?? Vote #1, #2, #3, or #4 in the comments!

Choosing the perfect wedding guest dress can be a challenge!

First, not all weddings are created equal. They are all in different locations, at different times with different levels of dress. There are a few key things you need to know about the event itself before choosing a dress... the venue, the time of day (night weddings are dressier), and dress code.

Then consider your own preferences...
Do you prefer something longer like midi length? What flatters your shape best? Avoiding white or blush of course, what are your favorite colors? I LOVE pink, blue, and, green… any saturated jewel tones! 

Once you have all of those questions answered, narrow your search to your TOP THREE options. Try on each option and take mirror selfies wearing the dress or jumpsuit. The pictures will help you to see how the dress photographs, so you can choose the most flattering option for you! 

Are you heading to any weddings this spring or summer? Have you found something to wear yet? Please let us know how we can help in the comments below! Sex over 40... yep, we're going there!!! 

The ladies on Team Busbee have come together to share everything we've learned and wish we knew sooner about sex and monopause over 40. Are we sexperts? That'd be a no, with a capital N. 6 KEY style tips I learned from almost 15 years of working in fashion...

Before my @youtube channel and the blog, I worked as a personal stylist for a handful of years. Through my experiences, I’ve learned A LOT. These are 6 of my top style tips (more to come!)...

1 | It’s important to have a style uniform. That’s your go-to outfit that you know looks amazing on you that you can throw on in a pinch. Simply vary pieces and accessories to keep your uniform fresh!
2 | When budgeting for your wardrobe, plan to spend 80% of your budget on basics and 20% on trends. 
3 | Every season there are new trends. Don’t feel pressure to try the trends, and only wear the ones that resonate with you.
4 | Dress for you! Don’t worry about what anyone else thinks.
5 | If you are a little scared of printed clothing...start with one printed piece in a small-scale print like stripes or polka dots and keep the rest of your outfit neutral and classic.
6 | Skip fast fashion. I know the cheap buys are tempting, but for the most part they will not wash and wear well. Plus, it’s not great for the environment.

Which of these tips resonates most with you? Do you have a style tip to add? Please let me know in the comments! 

~Erin xo

Through my years as a personal stylist and with my own personal experience, I have found so many useful tricks over the years to help elongate my frame and look taller and slimmer. These simple style tips are geared toward petite women, which means 5’4” and under… but they’re applicable for anyone, really!

1 | Match your shoes to your skin tone.
2 | Wear high-rise pants or jeans.
3 | Match your shoes to your pants. 
4 | Avoid cropped or ankle length pants and jeans.
5 | Wear similar colors from head-to-toe. 
6 | Wear a shorter skirt vs. a longer skirt. 
7 | Wear pointed-toe shoes.
8 | Look for cropped jackets vs mid-length.
9 | Wear heels vs. flats.

Which tip will you try first??

These are just a few of the lessons I’ve learned after almost 15 years in fashion...

Before my @youtube channel and blog, I worked as a personal stylist for a handful of years. With each of these experiences, I’ve learned A LOT. These are a few of my key takeaways…

#1 | If you want a failsafe way to add more color to your wardrobe, choose one piece, in one color and pair it with your neutrals.
#2 | I like drama in my clothes... not my life! 
#3 | Accessories can transform your outfit. Try adding one impactful piece of jewelry to every look to look more stylish.
#4 | Fabric matters, especially in the summer... the more organic natural fabrics like cotton, linen, and silk will be more breathable, keep you cooler... they tend to look more luxe... AND they are more eco-friendly!
#5 | You CAN wear mixed metals like silver and gold together.
#6 | You don’t have to match your belt to your bag and shoes. Feel free to mix them up!

Which of these tips resonates most with you? Do you have a style tip to add? Please let me know in the comments!

Follow these steps for an effortlessly chic way to tie your scarves this fall and winter! 

I wore this really cool scarf in a recent post, and I’ve had so many of you reach out to ask how I tied it... Luckily, it’s SO easy to do! And you can tie any square scarf like this... even a smaller one. The smaller scarves will be more of a neck-tie... which can be a really lovely addition to a blazer, button-down, or feminine jacket. 

#1 | Fold your scarf in half into a triangle.
#2 | Roll the triangle lengthwise.
#3 | Loop it around your neck once.
#4 | Loop it around your neck a second time. 

Leave it as-is... OR tie the ends into a half knot and adjust the knot to be as loose or tight as you want. That’s it!

Follow these tips and tricks will help you to look and feel your best over 40! 

#1 | Skip Matte Makeup - In general, as we get older, our skin gets drier and has more wrinkles, creases, and cracks. So you’ll want to go with a creamy, hydrating, dewy makeup routine.
#2 | Apply Blush Strategically - Apply your blush higher on the cheek (not right on the apple) and apply it in a circular motion upwards to give that lifting effect.
#3 | Contour Your Lips - Shading around the lips with a darker line will create the illusion of fuller lips in a super subtle way. 
#4 | Don’t Over-Tweeze - Did you over-tweeze in the 90s’ like I did!? Thicker brows are definitely IN! A thicker, fuller, more natural brow is much more youthful. I grew mine back over 6+ weeks using NeuBrow growth serum. (link to shop in stories)
#5 | Whiten Teeth - Nothing ages you faster than yellow teeth. Drinking coffee, tea, etc., and eating certain foods will inevitably turn your teeth a little yellow. I’ve tried a couple of things…ultraviolet light, whitening strips, etc. But in my opinion, the best option is to go to the dentist and get the impressions done, use the gel they give you, and your teeth will get a lot whiter!
#6 | Take Care of Your Hair - Dry, frizzy hair can be aging while shiny hair looks more youthful! Make sure you’re using a good shampoo and conditioner for this.
#7 | Try Collagen Powder - Collagen powder in my morning coffee has completely changed my hair... It’s so much thicker!! I’ve noticed a HUGE difference and cannot recommend this enough! 

For more tips and tricks on how to look youthful, head to BusbeeStyle.com (the link is in bio). What tips would you add to the list??

Do you love white jeans as much as I do? Or are you hesitant when it comes to white jeans because you’ve struggled to find the right pair?? 

White jeans are certainly a summer staple… but you really can wear them all year round! Which makes them an important wardrobe basic. Here are the top things to consider when choosing the BEST pair of white jeans (and when styling them!)...

#1 | Sizing - When ordering a pair of jeans, make sure you check the size chart ALWAYS. It just saves a lot of time on the backend and you’re less likely to have to deal with returns. I also typically size up one size with white jeans. This gives you a bit more breathing room and forgiveness, especially with the premium brands where the denim just doesn’t stretch as much. A little extra room can be nice. 
#2 | Fabric Choice - The thickness of the denim matters since white is inherently see-through. With some of the less expensive brands, you want to watch out for paper-thin denim where you can see every lump and bump, panty lines…ALL of it. A thicker denim will keep everything looking more streamlined and covered.
#3 | Shoe Choice - You can wear dark shoes with white jeans, but if you want to elongate your frame and look slimmer, a neutral or skin-tone shoe is going to be more flattering in general. 
#4 | Wash Wisely - If I’m wearing white jeans to dinner, I strategically place a few napkins over the jeans to help avoid stains, but if I do have a stain, I spot treat as soon as I can and then wash in cold with gentle detergent and NEVER put them in the dryer. That’s really the secret to keeping all of your whites super white!
BONUS TIP: Opt for skin-colored undergarments to keep your intimates “intimate.”

When you look into your closet, do you feel like you have nothing to wear?? 

Over time, your closet can fill with ill-fitting and outdated pieces as your body changes and trends come and go... this can lead to a feeling like you have nothing good to wear. BUT before you go shopping for more, the first thing to do is a closet edit... aka “a closet cleanout.” A full closet edit means going through everything you have in your closet(s) and weeding out the things you aren’t wearing or no longer need. You should edit your closet one or two times a year during the change of seasons... which means it’s about that time!!! 

As you go through you closet, ask yourself the following questions to decide what to keep and what to get rid of...
1 | Does this garment fit and flatter my body NOW? Body shapes can change over time... don’t hang onto those pieces that no longer look flattering.
2 | Does this piece have stains, rips, or fading? ...that’s a TOSS! 
3 | Can I fit in this piece? SO many of us are guilty of holding onto pieces that no longer fit us in hopes we will be able to wear them again. Dress the beautiful body you have right now. 
4 | Have I worn it in the last two years? There’s no reason to keep items you don’t wear unless you truly love them. Donate them and let someone else enjoy these beautiful pieces! Exceptions include wedding dresses or anything that is very close to your heart. 

Once you’ve finished your closet edit, it’s time to make sure you have all your wardrobe basics covered. Not sure what those pieces are?? No appointment necessary - Look more youthful with these simple beauty tips! 💄

#1 | Exfoliate & Hydrate Your Lips - Minimize fine lines around your lips by exfoliating them regularly and applying a lip mask at night.
#2 | Build A Pro-Aging Skincare Routine - Key ingredients you should include in your skincare routine are Vitamin C, Alpha Hydroxy Acids, hydroquinone, and retinol. 
#3 | Use Root Touch-Up Spray - This is a simple way to conceal bald spots, thinning hairlines, and grown-out roots! It will make it look like you have WAY more hair!
#4 | Erase Dark Circles - I don’t know about you, but my dark circles have gotten a lot worse with age! Anyone else? The first step to covering up those dark eye circles is to use an eye primer… Then apply a waterproof concealer.
#5 | Apply Contour and Concealer BEFORE Foundation - For a youthful, dewy makeup look, try applying your contour and concealer before you apply your foundation. I know, it feels wrong… But it looks SO good.

What other amazing pro-aging beauty tips do you have? Please share in the comments so we can all benefit!!

Look more modern and chic with these simple style swaps!!! 

1 | Swap your oversized boyfriend blazers for tailored blazers — While oversized blazers still have a place in your closet, the “quiet luxury” trend has created a shift towards blazers and jackets with more tailored fits. 
2 | Swap your jeans for cargo pants — Cargo everything is on trend, but cargo pants are definitely one of the most popular ways to wear the trend. I recommend choosing cargo pants in a neutral color in your favorite fit... If you love wide-leg jeans, try a pair of wide-leg cargo pants! If you prefer joggers, try a pair of cargo joggers! 
3 | Swap your skinny jeans for flares or wide-leg jeans — If you haven’t already tucked your skinnies aside, consider doing so this fall. Definitely keep some on hand for wearing with tall boots, but opt for more flattering and trendier wider-leg fits. 
4 | Swap your regular sneakers (👀 those Golden Goose sneakers) for trainers or platform sneakers — First things first: Don’t go tossing out your other sneakers... like the other pieces I recommended you swap, they still have a place in your closet!!! Swapping your basic white sneakers for trainers or platform sneakers simply helps to give your outfit a more stylish and modern appearance. 

Lastly, remember to only wear the trends that speak to you... not every trend is for everyone!

One of my favorite style tweaks to do in the fall/winter is tying a half-knot with the belts on my coats and jackets. It’s such a simple change, but it packs a sophisticated style punch! Plus, it’s super simple to do...

1 | Pull the belt straps to one side and create a knot. One strap should be six inches longer. 
2 | Grab the “longer” strap and wrap it around the shorter one, creating another knot, BUT... 
3 | Instead of pulling the long side all the way through, make it a half loop. Adjust as necessary. 

That’s it! It sounds much more complex than it actually is... and it looks much more elevated than a regular knot or bow. 

Be sure to bookmark this video so you can come back to it! And drop a 💃💃💃 if you’re excited to try this little trick this fall/winter! 

~Erin xo

Are you simply wearing your clothes... or are you styling your clothes?? I’m sharing my TOP simple style tips to elevate your outfits today on @youtube! Comment “STYLE TIPS” and I will send you a DM with a link to watch! 

If you’re busy or feeling unmotivated, styling your clothes can seem like a lot of work. It’s easy to get into the habit of throwing on a few basics and heading out the door. BUT, taking the time to put some thought into the seemingly small details can totally transform your look. These small styling tweaks are what make the difference and add almost effortless polish and sophistication to your outfits... and the more you do them, the more effortless they become:

#1 | Tuck your top & add a belt - Try one or both for instant waist definition!
#2 | Add a 3rd layer - The right 3rd layer adds polish, but can also be a strategic piece to mask a tummy or add waist definition depending on the style.
#3 | Swap the shoes - Pointed-toe shoes elongate the legs, and heels help to create the illusion you are taller and leaner. 
#4 | Add jewelry - The right jewelry can immediately take an outfit from “fine” to “fab!” I recommend finding a few go-to versatile pieces you love that you can easily throw on day-to-day.

Finding the perfect pair of jeans can be tricky, because we all have such different body shapes. Has anyone ever seen “The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants?” While it’s a cool concept… chances are, you won’t find a pair of jeans that magically fits you and your 3 best friends. BUT, you can find a pair of jeans that are slimming, flattering, and fit your body just right. 

You just need to know a few important things before buying jeans… which is why I’m sharing 6 key tips on how to select the most flattering jeans:

#1 | Choose Dark Wash Denim - A dark wash jean is not only extremely versatile, but it elongates your legs and slims your body. 
#2 | Look for Matching Stitching - If you’re trying to find a pair of jeans that is the most flattering and slimming, you’ll want to find a pair with no contrasting stitching. 
#3 | Know Your Ideal Inseam Length - No matter what your height, knowing your inseam length is SO key to finding the right pair of jeans and looking slimmer in them. Cropped jeans cut the leg-line short, whereas jeans that are too long will need to be hemmed which can compromise the integrity of the jeans. 
#4 | Opt for High-Rise Jeans - High-rise jeans help to slim and smooth your midsection.
#5 | Be Mindful of Zipper Length - A pair of jeans that have a long zipper length with little space between the end of the zipper and the crotch of the jeans will also actually make your legs look longer.
#6 | Find Your Brand - When you find a pair of jeans that flatters your body shape, makes your legs look longer, makes your tummy feel slimmer, and makes you feel confident…buy a second pair! And, look at that brand and see if there are other pairs of jeans you can try.

Looking for a great pair of super flattering denim? I’m sharing a roundup of my favorite jeans for every budget in my stories. You can also find my denim favorites on the @shop.LTK app. Comment “FALL DENIM” and I’ll send you a link to shop!

“For me, one of my primary struggles was feeling *worthy.* Growing up with a single mom who was responsible for four children on a nurse’s salary, our family struggled financially. The old scarcity mindset creeps in sometimes dictating financial decisions. I also kept thinking to myself, “Do I really deserve such extravagant gift like a Chanel bag? And wouldn’t it be better just to save that money or spend it on my kids?

When I was 25 and working as an Executive Assistant to the President at The Miss Universe Organization in New York City, I was asked to pick up a gift for a former Miss Universe at Bergdorf Goodman. If you have been to this flagship store, you know how over-the-top stunning and luxe it really is. I walked in there completely unprepared for how out of place I would feel. I felt eyes leering at me and I was sure they thought I didn’t belong there. And I could not wait to leave! I guess you could call it my Julia Roberts “Pretty Woman” moment- minus the prostitute part ;). So, fast forward to last year… my family and I were in NYC for the marathon. As we walked by Bergdorf’s, I shared that exact story with my kids, and, spontaneously said, “Let’s go in! It’s such a beautiful store, I want you both to see it! I wanted to prove to my kids and to myself that we all belonged in that high-end store. It was a full-circle moment and the complete opposite of how I felt during that very first shopping experience. Instead of feeling insecure, I went straight to the Chanel section and started browsing… and would you believe they had the bag... the Chanel bag I had been looking to buy for YEARS! Without hesitation, I bought it. It was meant to be...”

The rest of my story is on the blog... <3 Comment “I AM WORTHY” and I’ll send you a message with the link to read.

Yep, we’re going there... these 5 style tips and clothing pieces have stirred up SO much controversary over the years, but here’s why we stand behind them...

1 | The Half-Tuck - This simple style tweak adds instant waist definition and effortless polish to your outfit. This is a great trick to use when a full tuck feels too formal or there’s too much material to tuck your entire top without excess bulk. 
2 | Golden Goose Sneakers - I get it... they’re expensive. Many of you strongly dislike the grungy style of a lot of their styles. But they are incredibly comfortable without any break-in time, and they pair really well with so many outfits. GG or not, I would say it’s really important to have a pair of versatile, super comfy sneakers that you can wear with dresses, pants, jeans, shorts, and skirts. 
3 | White Jeans and Pants - Not all white jeans and pants are created equal. I think the KEY to wearing and loving white bottoms is choosing a high-quality pair, looking for flattering details (no pockets or built-in shapewear), sizing up, and never putting them in the dryer! Keeping your whites out of the dryer prevents stains from setting and keeps them looking white longer. 
4 | Blazers - These add sophistication, they add polish, they keep you warm, and they can even help to create the illusion of a slimmer silhouette depending on the fit. They happen to also be very on-trend right now. 
5 | Pointed-Toe Shoes - These are very feminine, flattering, they elongate the body, and they make your legs look longer, BUT they can be restrictive. If your feet are uncomfortable when you wear pointed-toe shoes, I recommend looking for a pair with a wider-toe box. 

How do you feel about these tips and pieces?? Comment “STYLE TIPS” and I’ll send you a link to watch my full YouTube video covering these controversial, but super chic style tips and pieces! 

~Erin xo

After working in fashion for 15 years, these are a few of the most important tips I’ve learned...

1 | There’s no age limit in fashion. Wear what lights YOU up and makes you feel like the best version of you. Miniskirts and bikinis over 40? Why not??
2 | You’re worth it. Just buy it.
3 | Don’t let age or societal programming about age get in the way of your style. Wear what makes you happy! 
4 | It’s okay to take care of everyone... Just don’t forget the most important person on the list - YOU.
5 | Fashion is meant to be fun. So go ahead... release your inner child and play dress up. You have to get dressed every single day anyway, so why not make it fun?
6 | Every season there are new trends. Don’t feel pressured to try the trends and only wear the ones that really resonate with you.

Which of these trends is your favorite??

Each season I share the best and most wearable fashion trends... While some trends are more intense and don’t necessarily incorporate easily into your wardrobe, these are the trends that you can actually wear and feel amazing in. As with all trends, you should pick and choose the ones you love the most and then aim to give the trends your very own spin…make them your own! You also do NOT have to try ANY of these trends. I just want to make sure you have all the resources you need to be your most stylish self! 

My top 5 trends to try?
#1 | Fired Up - Red Everything! Red can be a tricky color to wear, but there are SO many shades of this hue so you can find one that works for your skin tone. 
#2 | Spot On - Think polka dot tops, dresses, scarves, and sweaters! I also predict that this trend will carry over to spring too. 
#3 | SO hip! -  Peplum hems help create the illusion of that coveted hourglass silhouette and are just so flattering.
#4 | Power Play - Try strong shoulders, elevated, strong suiting, pinstripes, and neckties. I told you these trends were nostalgic… anyone remember the giant shoulder pads of the 80s?? 
#5 | Back to Basics - If you’ve heard the term “ quiet luxury” or stealth wealth over the past few months… that’s basically what this is! The idea is to give off the look of elegance and sophistication, in an understated way.

~Erin xo

You deserve to look and feel amazing... and if you don’t, I guarantee it’s because of one of these FIVE things...

1 | You don’t have the proper wardrobe basics - 99% of the time when I was styling women, they didn’t have their basics. These are the foundational building blocks of your wardrobe - without them, your wardrobe simply will not function. I have a full course called “Style Made Simple” that will help you with this (the link is in my bio). 
2 | You’re not dressing the body you have - You must dress the body you have now, not the hypothetical one you aspire to. This can be really difficult and even I am guilty of this too. I just shared a story with my newsletter subscribers about how I had hung onto a jumpsuit that I hadn’t fit into in YEARS, just in case. If your clothes are ill-fitting, you won’t feel or look comfortable. 
3 | Your closet is a mess - When was the last time you edited your closet? It’s super important to edit your closet at least twice a year. If you’re a newsletter subscriber, you can find a full closet editing checklist in the freebies I sent! 
4 | One word... GUILT - Many of us experience this on a regular basis. You may feel guilty investing in yourself. But just like I said in the beginning -you deserve to feel and look amazing... no strings attached. 
5 | You put everybody else first - This is a tricky one. You want to take care of those around you... so you put the kids, the house, your husband, work, pets, and everything else above YOU. But you have to recognize the importance of taking care of yourself and investing in yourself. By taking time and making time for you, you will be a better wife, mother, friend, sister, cousin, employee, etc. 

Do you struggle with any of these? Which resonates with you most?

~Erin xo

Do you want to look more luxe and glamorous this fall and winter? These seemingly small tips will make a BIG IMPACT on your overall style and make you look like a million bucks...

#1 | Find a Strategic Investment Piece - I highly recommend getting one high-end designer bag and/or belt. These can be worn every day and will instantly elevate your outfit. 
#2 | Wear Rich Colors - There are certain tones that look more luxe than others, like white, beige, camel, black, cognac, chocolate, and burgundy. 
#3 | Add More Texture - Faux fur, leather, chunky knits, croc-embossed, or suede pieces can really elevate your look. 
#4 | Choose Impactful Accessories - You don't have to go overboard with accessories. It's really about choosing impactful pieces that will complement and elevate your outfit. 
#5 | Basics Win Every Time - If your goal is to look as luxe as possible, choose classic wardrobe basics that are flattering to your body. This will result in a timeless "quiet luxury" look.

The secret to great style probably isn’t what you think… 

It really boils down to your ability to take risks. Yep, that’s it. IF you are willing to take fashion risks and play around with fashion, you will not only look more stylish, you will also become more of the confident amazing woman you are meant to be! 

Taking chances can be downright scary. And the idea of standing out is next-level terrifying for some of us... myself included. Staying small, staying hidden, staying in the rut feels SAFER. But it also means staying stuck. 

Slowly, over years, step by uncomfortable step, I’ve taken more risks with fashion and beauty… and those small steps add up! Younger Erin would have never had the confidence to offer other women styling advice… and now it’s the heart of my thriving business and a community of more than 1 million women! 

Think of something you can do to push yourself a little in the style or beauty department. Then, please share your step in the comments. 

Remember that by sharing your thoughts you are likely giving other women ideas… and also permission to make their own changes.

~Erin xo

#ad Let’s talk patterns... For many years, I wasn’t really a huge fan of patterns. In fact, it was only in the last few years after living abroad in Spain that I began investing in more prints. And now, with the right pattern, I’m a BIG fan! Case in point - these 2 beautiful @shopbop finds! 

The key to wearing prints is choosing ones that flatter your body. This means considering the pattern itself, the size of the pattern, where the pattern will be worn, and the colors in the pattern. Here are a few tips to consider:

#1 | When in doubt, choose classic patterns like polka dots, florals, stripes, plaid, or houndstooth.
#2 | Opt for smaller prints - Oversized prints can make you appear larger. 
#3 | Use patterns to your advantage - A pattern piece can draw attention to a certain area. Strategically highlight your assets or balance proportions with pattern pieces. For example, a polka dot top paired with black pants can help to balance the silhouette of a triangle body shape. 

Comment “PATTERN” and I’ll send you a link to shop both of these looks!

#ad @Lucchese boots are not only beautiful, high-quality western boots... they also hold a lot of sentimental value for me. In fact, my very first gift from my husband, Chris, was a pair of Lucchese boots. #MyLucchese

Very soon after Chris and I started dating in 2005, he invited me to Texas to meet his mom and stepfather. He also wanted to take me to my very first rodeo... When in Texas, right? So, he told me it was really important we dress the part... that *everyone* at the rodeo dresses in western wear from head to toe. We stopped off at a western wear shop, and he told me to pick out any boots I wanted for the rodeo. I ended up picking out the “Savannah” boot by Lucchese, which I still own to this day! We bought the boots, and I got a few other western pieces, then we made our way to the San Antonio rodeo...

There I was decked out in a cowboy hat, snap-button western shirt, blue jeans, western belt, and my Lucchese boots... and, of course, hardly anyone at the rodeo was actually wearing head-to-toe western gear. Chris had duped me! Fortunately, I have a pretty decent sense of humor and just went with it. 

Since that experience, these awesome boots have taken me to multiple rodeos, ranches, dance halls, chuck wagon dinners, you name it...for more than two decades.

Who else is loving this video trend?? I’m a bit late to the game, but I think these videos are really fun to watch AND they show how taking the time to put some thought into seemingly small details can totally transform your look. Try these easy styling tweaks to add polish and sophistication to your outfits... 

1 | Tuck your top & add a belt - Try one or both for instant waist definition!
2 | Add a 3rd layer - The right 3rd layer adds polish but can also be a strategic piece to mask a tummy or add waist definition depending on the style.
3 | Be selective with shoes - Pointed-toe shoes elongate the legs, and heels help to create the illusion you are taller and leaner. 
4 | Add jewelry - The right jewelry can immediately take an outfit from “fine” to “fab!” I recommend finding a few go-to versatile pieces you love that you can easily throw on day-to-day. 

I hope you’ve been enjoying a wonderful holiday week!

Who else LOVED the show “What Not to Wear?” 🙋🏼‍♀️🙋🏼‍♀️🙋🏼‍♀️While I personally loved watching the show… I think the age of “style rules” has come to an appropriate end. 

Now, that’s not to say there aren’t helpful general guidelines and tips you can follow to dress in a way that flatters your body most, but the concept that you shouldn’t or can’t wear something because of your age, size, body shape, etc. is dated and quite frankly… boring! I’ve seen so many women (myself included) become insecure about what to wear because of body and age changes. Your style is a form of expression… and how you dress should be an extension of who you are and how you feel. 

When we let our own fear and insecurity get in the way, we put ourselves in a box. I say we step into our power… becoming the bold, beautiful women we are!!! And the first simple step to take is… Taking a fashion risk. 

I fell in love with this pink sequin suit the moment I saw it, but I’ll admit, my first thoughts were talking myself out of buying it because of its bold color, style, and sparkle. Now, I have a picture of me wearing it in West Texas in my cloffice (closet-office) as a beautiful reminder to me of this very message. 💖 

Your fashion risk could be a pink sequin suit, like mine, or it could be a bold color or print… maybe even a sexy stiletto! Which trend or fashion risk will you try next? I’d love to hear about it in the comments! 

~Erin xo

When you feel good… you look good. ✨

That sentence is often heard the other way around. The truth of the matter is that when you feel peaceful, confident, and free inside... everything else reflects that on the outside. Our style is an extension of who we are and how we feel. 

If you’re like me, maybe you have struggled with how you see your body or physical changes that have come with aging, leaving you feeling insecure. Your relationship with your body affects your style… I shared a pretty emotional YouTube video last year with some of my personal struggles along with ways we can begin to reframe any negative dialogue we have inside of us. If you’re interested in watching, comment “LINK” and I’ll send you a direct message with the link to watch. 

Remember… you deserve to be filled with love, light, and joy, and you deserve to shine… 💫 Exactly as you are right this moment. 

~Erin xo
